alert.note: Alert for Big Island Summit (Hawaii) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Wind Advisory issued January 29 at 3:53PM HST until January 30 at 6:00AM HST by NWS Honolulu
info.description: ...HIGH WIND ADVISORY IS IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY FOR THE BIG ISLAND SUMMITS OF MAUNA KEA AND MAUNA LOA... .The High Wind Warning has been downgraded to a High Wind Advisory for the Big Island summits this evening due. Advisory level winds are currently being observed at the summits. ...WIND ADVISORY IN EFFECT UNTIL 6 AM HST TUESDAY... ...HIGH WIND WARNING IS CANCELLED... * WHAT...Winds 45 to 55 mph with localized gusts to 65 mph. * WHERE...Big Island Summits. * WHEN...Until 6 AM HST Tuesday. * IMPACTS...Winds this strong can make driving and walking difficult. These winds can forcefully open doors and damage hinges or slam doors shut, possibly causing injuries.
info.instruction: Consider postponing travel to the summits until conditions improve. If you must travel to the summits, use extra caution walking and driving. Be careful opening or closing doors.
